hints.content:
We can think of division as the following:

$\greenD{\text{ Total}}\div\blueD{\text{ Number of Groups}}$

or 

$\greenD{\text{ Total}}\div\maroonD{\text{ Size of the Groups}}$

We have a $\greenD{\text{total}}$ of $\greenD{14}$ hens.

The $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$ of hens is $\blueD7$.  

Which image shows $\greenD{14}$ hens divided  evenly in $\blueD{7}$ groups?

This image represents the situation:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Seven groups of 2 hens. Each group of hens has a circle around it. !

question.content:
There are $14$ hens divided evenly in $7$ chicken coops.

**Which image could represent this situation?**


[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![Six groups of 2 hens. Each group of hens has a circle around it.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ab7175aa1c45411a6d8e1ba02cd6f9fc3a320d03)
![Seven groups of 2 hens. Each group of hens has a circle around it.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/09d8e1bd5af5eff66d936fb3e9d8193f68f10db9)
![Two groups of 6 hens. Each group of hens has a circle around it.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/977a0de5f72e0897ec1b11a151a2849cd9ba4565)
